result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Joseph Organ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to Withdraw
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

3:33 PM Defendant Matthew Joseph Organ appeared by video.  Attorney Saralinda R Watts appeared by video for Matthew Joseph Organ.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Watts states she believes there is a resolution and requests a breakout room.   3:35pm  Breakout room  3:46pm  Breakout room closed.
Atty Watts states there is a resolution.  States plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 5 and State will move to dismiss and read-in Cts 4 & 6.  Atty Burdon agrees.  Defendant agrees to continue today by Zoom.
Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge. Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 5.  Court questions Atty Watts.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently. Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis. BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 5 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. Counts 4 & 6 are ordered dismissed and read-in.
Counsel make sentencing statements.  Defendant makes statement.

BY THE COURT:  Ct 5:  Court sentences defendant to serve 3 months in the Marquette County Jail, consecutive to any other sentence, STAYED, and defendant placed on probation for a period of 1 year with conditions:
*AODA and comply with any follow-up treatment
*No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
*Any other treatment deemed necessary by the agent
*Pay costs of $443.00
*Submit DNA sample
*Granted 14 days credit if probation is revoked
*Cash bond on file to be applied
Amended

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
